Description: Fragment of oval handle of a pottery transport amphora at neck join. Clay coarse, micaceous, red-brown. Rectangular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 200, 15 A parallel is in the Benaki collection, Alexandria Museum. Probably a product of the Sophanes workshop at Muhaltepe on the Knidian peninsula (Empereur and Tuna, BCH 112 (1988) 350-3, with fig 5,1). There are traces of what appears to be ink on the underside, presumably written before Petrie trimmed the reverse
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1499)
